pullRequest.body:
Expresses `L.lan` as a fiberwise colimit and uses this result to transform  every colimit into a colimit on the Grothendieck construction on costructured arrows.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11825522486/job/32949484010)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11825522486/job/32949483748)

Thanks!
bors r+

Thanks!
bors r+
Is there a problem with making this a global instance?
I think you should remove this annotation and make the two lemmas below `reassoc (attr := simp)`.

Not sure if it's better, but it's possible:
```suggestion
  exact (ι_colimitIsoColimitGrothendieck_inv L G ⟨L.obj X, .mk (𝟙 _)⟩).symm
```
I think I would just inline this into the definition of `lanObjIsoFiberwiseColimit`.
How hard would it be to restructure the sectioning of the file so that this `omit` is not necessary? `omit` is supposed to be a last resort.

Optional suggestion: as someone who didn't already know why the result is true, I find this easier to read:
```suggestion
    colimit G ≅ colimit (CostructuredArrow.grothendieckProj L ⋙ G) := calc
  colimit G
    ≅ (L.lan ⋙ colim).obj G := ((lanCompColimIso L).app G).symm
  _ ≅ colimit (fiberwiseColimit (CostructuredArrow.grothendieckProj L ⋙ G)) :=
        HasColimit.isoOfNatIso (lanObjIsoFiberwiseColimit L G)
  _ ≅ colimit (CostructuredArrow.grothendieckProj L ⋙ G) :=
        colimitFiberwiseColimitIso _
```
I wonder if this theorem really needs that the (non-pointwise) left Kan extension exists everywhere.
Good point, I think we can avoid it actually, involves changing a few other definitions that unnecessarily assume it
This docstring doesn't really make sense to me, are you sure' it's correct?
Not sure what you mean, should i mention `CostructuredArrow.grothendieckProj` explicitly instead of just saying "a canonical functor ..."?
Shouldn't the beginning of the sentence be more like "if `G : C => H` admits a pointwise left Kan extension along `L : C => D` and ..."?
Ah, right, I always autocorrected that in my head when I read it

```suggestion
      fun X => hasColimitOfIso <| Iso.symm <| isoWhiskerRight (eqToIso ((functor L).map_id X)) _ ≪≫
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): Every colimit is a colimit on the Grothendieck construction on costructured arrows
